Calculate mean by factors

Source: R/RcppExports.R
cpp_mean.Rd

These functions calculate the arithmetic and geometric mean of the weight for each class. geometric_mean and arithmetic_mean return a numeric vector of the same length as w which stores the averaged weight for each observation. geometric_mean_reference returns the same value by reference, i.e. the input value w gets overwritten by the updated weights. See examples.

geometric_mean_reference(w, classes)

geometric_mean(w, classes)

arithmetic_mean(w, classes)

Arguments

w

An numeric vector. All entries should be positive.
classes

A factor variable. Must have the same length as w.

Examples


## create random data
nobs <- 10
classLabels <- letters[1:3]
dat = data.frame(
  weight = exp(rnorm(nobs)),
  household = factor(sample(classLabels, nobs, replace = TRUE))
)
dat
#>       weight household
#> 1  0.5742379         b
#> 2  0.7740763         b
#> 3  1.1713674         c
#> 4  2.4380862         c
#> 5  0.7676065         b
#> 6  0.3811474         c
#> 7  0.3532502         c
#> 8  1.9870001         a
#> 9  0.1038353         c
#> 10 1.3444889         b

## calculate weights with geometric_mean
geom_weight <- geometric_mean(dat$weight, dat$household)
cbind(dat, geom_weight)
#>       weight household geom_weight
#> 1  0.5742379         b   0.8229868
#> 2  0.7740763         b   0.8229868
#> 3  1.1713674         c   0.5251127
#> 4  2.4380862         c   0.5251127
#> 5  0.7676065         b   0.8229868
#> 6  0.3811474         c   0.5251127
#> 7  0.3532502         c   0.5251127
#> 8  1.9870001         a   1.9870001
#> 9  0.1038353         c   0.5251127
#> 10 1.3444889         b   0.8229868

## calculate weights with arithmetic_mean
arith_weight <- arithmetic_mean(dat$weight, dat$household)
cbind(dat, arith_weight)
#>       weight household arith_weight
#> 1  0.5742379         b    0.8651024
#> 2  0.7740763         b    0.8651024
#> 3  1.1713674         c    0.8895373
#> 4  2.4380862         c    0.8895373
#> 5  0.7676065         b    0.8651024
#> 6  0.3811474         c    0.8895373
#> 7  0.3532502         c    0.8895373
#> 8  1.9870001         a    1.9870001
#> 9  0.1038353         c    0.8895373
#> 10 1.3444889         b    0.8651024

## calculate weights "by reference"
geometric_mean_reference(dat$weight, dat$household)
dat
#>       weight household
#> 1  0.8229868         b
#> 2  0.8229868         b
#> 3  0.5251127         c
#> 4  0.5251127         c
#> 5  0.8229868         b
#> 6  0.5251127         c
#> 7  0.5251127         c
#> 8  1.9870001         a
#> 9  0.5251127         c
#> 10 0.8229868         b
